name: Ng-pageslide
tagline: AngularJS sliding panel for serving additional content
body:
# AngularJS Pageslide directive An [AngularJS](http://angularjs.org/) directive which slides another panel over your browser to reveal an additional interaction pane. Built from scratch to offer a basic sliding pane for Angular apps, CSS transitions and no jQuery required. ## Usage Add in your document head ``` ``` Use within your AngularJS app ``` var app = angular.module("app", ["pageslide-directive"]); ``` Your HTML should look like this ``` Link text

some random content...

Click to close
``` Where #target can be whatever you want ### Options: ``` pageslide = Where the panel should appear (right,left,top,bottom) ps-speed = The speed of the transition (optional) ``` ## Licensing Licensed under [GPL](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl.txt) ## Author 2013, Daniele Piccone [@danielepiccone](https://twitter.com/danielepiccone)
